post.body: So who else is heading off the internet grid?
Seems like zero chat is pretty dead right now, guess I'll have to wait until people actually wake up.
So, on getting back into a few things I came across this awesome page..tips possibly? On some privacy tips, for anyone interested (outside zero) https://www.privacytools.io/#webrtc

Here's another useful link I use to check if my DNS is being leaked behind my VPN, among other things (tor exit node and airvpn exit node). geo-location and to see if your torrents are actually hidden:
https://ipleak.net/
So someone just unloaded a bunch of educational udemy magnet links on zerotorrent. Careful on loading more links, will most likely crash your browser.
Seems to be getting pretty lively on here o.o....
Hello mates, seems that I've been away for awhile. How has everyone been? (Yep that's right, I'm asking).
So it seems that the chatrooms are very inactive, was thinking about cloning one over. Maybe give it a go and see how it works out. Among other things that have interested me.
Man, it seems my days are just meshing together. Night shifts are awesome and bad at the same time.

So, came across this gem : https://www.tixati.com/ 

Been using it ever since to torrent, I would say check it out if you've been using uTorrent/Bittorrent or anything relate-able to them. 

Been using tixati, and loving it so far. No complaints.

So I don't know if anyone has ever coded their own shell on windows. But for a change of pace I recommend : http://bb4win.sourceforge.net/bblean/

(I still use it today on Windows 7, haven't tested on Windows 10 yet). 
Reason I used it: Basically when I did low-end gaming the shell took up too much processing (for some odd reason) So I found this alternative, and because my start menu was my right click and everything was minimal. You can code it to however you want (open source).

So, let's talk android for a little. Anyone messed around with android (using your phone as a USB drive/Boot Drive/Running Linux in the Background of Android as if it was running as a Computer?) 

I can start posting stuff like that on here, as I have some phones setup as said above. 

Also Xposed is pretty awesome, if you haven't heard of it (for those with rooted androids).
Well, once more I have returned to this part of the tubes. Anything exciting happen since I left?

It looks like America, and the world, are going to be in for quite a bumpy ride for the next few years. I can't imagine what is going to happen. Riots and shootings have already seem to have started all over the US....And he isn't even in office yet. 

"One for all, and all unanimous"

Well, what what has happened in the last 24 hours has definitely been quite a ride. At least for us in the US. I wonder what's going to happen. Maybe one of those things like in V for Vendetta. But let's how he doesn't fuck up the whole world. 

"What lies within is unanimous"

So as much as I enjoy ZeroMePlus, it looks as though it doesn't load pictures properly. Just yet. A heads up to anyone using it and wondering why some posts are blank, the platform just needs to be updated a little.

Looks like everyone on the clearnet is losing their minds over the president elect. It's pretty interesting and horrible at the same time. Mainly because everyone lacks the knowledge they need to understand what's happening. The other half of it being racial discrimination coming out of the woods they were hiding in. This is going to be a very interesting 4 years indeed.

Hello again everyone, I've made my way back here somehow. So question, with everything happening who has been heightening their awareness with Security and how to possibly hide themselves. But has anyway got into Pen-testing (for better words) and net security work arounds?

comment.body: @tkarita: Well then o.o
@Cronianice: Ah, I meant heading off the whole "being tracked and located" term of being off the grid. It's a bit of a pain, but I'm working on it.

@CronianIce: The more you know, good thing I'm just a nobody with 0 threat. Honestly only looking for knowledge to further what I may or may not know. I'm not here to overthrow or plot anything that would raise my threat above more than a simple itch on someones back, or possibly a shiver running through someones body. But I definitely did learn something new from you, and that is what me being here is all about. So sir, I thank you.
@Fav: They definitely are, but their must've been a reason for it. Not sure though. Unless they just don't know.
@Fav: Yeah, I have to find the list of VPNs that were most recommended and post it up. Was a bunch I never heard of before but have been around for awhile.

@Spacewarrior02: http://127.0.0.1:43110/ZeroTorrent.bit/ 

You'll need to search around for the others, but I'll link you this one. KAT is also listed on zeronet, but 0 seeders, and I haven't thought about using it because of the takedown.

@tkarita: Yeah I saw that, but I mean the search does help a bit. So it's not entirely bad, but I haven't really 'used' it to know how bad the search really is. I just know there's some dude unloading a butt-ton of magnet links right now lol.

@tkarita: Holy shnitzel balls, didn't know that. 'The more you know' right =D. I was looking the site and stuff over when I first got on Znet -I've been to most places and still exploring and learning about things-

@Arne Bolen: Ooo very lovely link. But the ipleak.net actually shows Webrtc leaks too (which apparently is another type of communication from browsers that leaks your actual IP aside from your DNS). And don't hate me, but I don't use a firewall. Not sure why, even when I did 'said' things I really didn't use a firewall for any reason.

@Arne Bolen: Oh nice =D , didn't know where the webrtc was, and I always use a dummy OS if I'm on VPN for some reason. But it's just been a thing for me to not use a firewall, even before VPNs were a thing in my life.
@Arne Bolen: The reason I didn't see it because it doesn't show an IP for me xD. Because I disabled WebRTC on my browsers.
@Jayofthezero: That's good, glad you're doing fine. =D. Don't think I've seen his posts at all. Maybe because I'm not following them just yet.
@tkarita: That's pretty dope, If you need more tools to add on there (haven't used all of them but most of them) But this site is pretty good, https://www.privacytools.io/#webrtc

@Zerro: Oh that's pretty nice looking, love how the first picture is htop <3. Definitely gonna add it to my list of things to use when I recreate my server. I normally just ssh'd into my server and used the terminal as such on my phone.
Well all you have to do is click things, normally that works and will lead you to where you want to go...eventually.
@Eibriel: I don't know how I overlooked this, do you have a link? Can't seem to find it.
@Eibriel: Thank you ^^
It was only a matter of time. Guess we'll have to be careful as we proceed with zeronet if this is the case.
@Hexagon: yes I've come to realize this slowly as I've invested more time into learning politics. I must say I've never been more in-depth into the political world as I have been for this election.

@Durand: Oh yes, he hasn't even reached office yet and the amount of damage that has been down to years of progress has been phenomenal. It's like people became instantly stupid and forget that they were supposed to move forward. Not back to the 1920s-1950s. But soon they'll realize it was a bad move to bring back such discrimination as minorities are a lot more abundant now than they were during those times.
